question_content.barrons:question: Because the vast majority of Cambodia’s population is made up of members of a single ethnic group, the Khmer, the country possesses a (i) __________ unique in Southeast Asia that has (ii) __________ a strong sense of national identity.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
homogeneity; encouraged.

The key phrases here are single ethnic group and strong sense of national identity. How would you describe a population largely made up of members of a single ethnic group? You would call is basically homogeneous (all of the same kind; uniform). How would the homogeneity (uniformity of composition) of the nation’s population affect the country’s sense of national identity? Most likely, it would encourage or strengthen that sense of national identity.

Sophistication is incorrect. Nothing in the sentence suggests that Cambodia possesses a unique sophistication (refinement; worldly wisdom).

Heterodoxy is incorrect. Nothing in the sentence suggests that Cambodia possesses a unique heterodoxy (lack of orthodoxy).

Abandoned is incorrect. Nothing in the sentence suggests that Cambodia had abandoned or discarded its sense of national identity.

Exacerbated is incorrect. Nothing in the sentence suggests that Cambodia has exacerbated or aggravated its sense of national identity.
